message.content:
To rewrite this equation in standard form, we complete the square in $x$ and $y$: \begin{align*}
x^2 - 6x + y^2 + 2y + 6 &= 0 \\
(x^2 - 6x) + (y^2 + 2y) + 6 &= 0 \\
(x^2 - 6x + 9) + (y^2 + 2y + 1) &= 4 \\
(x - 3)^2 + (y + 1)^2 &= 4
\end{align*}Thus, the general form of the equation of the circle is $(x - h)^2 + (y - k)^2 = r^2$, where $(h,k)$ is the center of the circle.  We see that the center of this circle is $(3, -1)$, and the radius is $\boxed{2}$.
